Replies.Reply: Written by  John August       WHIRS and HUMS.    The screen flickers.
Victor, I don't know that it's...
So that's where my candlestick went.
I don't know that Victor has friends, dear. Other than Sparky.
Victor! Come on honey your going to be late. Go put Sparky in the backyard.
But there's no river. And no jungle.
Come on Victor- you can do it!
He was a great dog.    A great friend.
When you lose someone you love, they never really leave you. They just move into a special place in your heart. He'll always be there, Victor.
I know. If we could bring him back, we would.
Try and get some sleep sweet heart-
Then I'll need my waffle iron back, Mr. Director.
Then maybe when you're finished, you'll let me use it.
Victor!   Could you come down here please?
In fairness, he didn't write the textbook.
Now, where is my muffin tin?
Oh sweetheart, we'll help you look for Sparky but when we get back I think we need to have a little talk. Understood.
Mom, you have to wear the glasses.
I can fix this. C'mon boy!
I'll keep an eye on him.
Go on Sparky. That's right. Good boy.
Did you get that out of the litter box?
It says no death rays.    See?
I'm sorry Edgar. I just don't need a partner. I like to work alone.
Will you sign my permission slip?
I don't want him in my heart.    I want him here, with me.
It's my science project.   It's a robot.
Sorry, boy, but I can't let anyone know about you. They may not understand. So you need to stay here today.
Sorry you had to stay here alone all day.
What's the matter boy? Are you ok?
Alright, here lets top you up.
Edgar. What are you doing here?
Look, I don't know what you think I know, but I don't know it.
I think the wind and the lightning are part of the same thing, some kind of strange force. But the wind isn't strong enough to bring an animal back from the dead. For that, you need lightning.
You can't. This isn't an experiment. It's my dog.
I don't know.    It should have worked.
It's invisible. It's an invisible goldfish.
You can't tell anyone. You understand that, right? Not until we figure out how it works.
Ok, ok, sit still. Ssssh! Sparky.
Sorry, boy. But we can't risk anyone seeing you again.
Maybe it just hopped out.   Did you have the lid on?
Oh! Don't worry. I can fix that too.
Be quick, boy. They'll be home any minute.
Hi, Elsa.    What are you doing?
Elsa steps back from the fence.
I can't believe they let the gym teacher be the judge. She's not even interested in science.
I was doing my experiment, my project, and the first time it worked great. But the next time it didn't. I mean, it sort of worked, but then it didn't. And I don't know why.
No.    I just wanted it over.
I was doing it for the wrong reason.
No I have to go and find Sparky.
You said yourself: If you could bring back Sparky, you would.
I just wanted my dog back.
Mom! Dad! I'm going to check out the school and the park, you guys do the town square, ok?
Sparky it's OK boy, it's just me.
Did you see those things? They were like....
Your sea monkeys, were they freshwater or saltwater?
Hang on don't let go  Victor holds his hand out trying to get hold of Elsa.
You said that I need to let him go...
It's okay, boy. You don't have to come back. You'll always be in my heart.
Oh, isn't that your grandmother's table cloth.
Oh that is so...Woah! I just felt I was attacked.
Yeah, it was a big finish. Well done son.
All that time he spends up there.
That's my point! I don't want him to turn out, y'know, weird.
Victor, have I ever talked to you about what I do for a living?
I sell dreams. I tell people, you can sail to Italy. You can do the hula in Hawaii.

In my job, sometimes you have people who don't want quite the same thing, right. Say the husband wants to play golf in Scotland, but the wife wants to paddle down the Amazon. Alright you've got two conflicting ideas here.
And it's my job, Victor, to help them meet halfway. Say, Scottsdale, Arizona. He gets to golf, she gets Indians.
Exactly. And wrong. They both get what they want because they compromise.
You'd like to do this science fair. And that's great. I'd like you to try a sport. Say, I don't know, baseball. Science fair, baseball. Science fair, baseball.
Come on Victor, please. Tie Sparky up and get your head into the game.
The best dog a kid could have.
Mr Mayor, Edward Frankenstein, your neighbour of course. I would just like to say that our son Victor is just crazy about the new teacher. Thinks he's great.
Shouldn't we at least give the man the chance to explain himself?
Yes, but that was different, because we couldn't!
Now lets go find your dog.
Victor? Is there anything we can do for you?
Sometimes adults don't know what they're talking about.
Your dog has been sniffing around my Dutch Dazzlers. The other day I caught him peeing on my flamingo.
Where do you think you're going?
Is that so. What about that dog of yours?
I want you to remember something, while your parents are away I am in charge here.
Dutch Day is coming up and I don't need any trouble. How's your song coming?
Keep at it. Dutch day is a big day for me.
As mayor of New Holland, you have entrusted me with your safety. So I can't sit idly by while a teacher endangers our children.
Thank you, thank you so much. And now, it's my pleasure to introduce this year's Little Dutch Girl, my niece, Elsa Van Helsing.
Nonsense. We have the fire chief over here.
You know, a lot of girls would kill to be in your place.
And now for our next act we have something really big.
Burgemeister flees, leaving Elsa to her own devices. He rushes through to the back of the stage.
I knew it! It's the boys dead dog!
That's Elsa's wig! Where's my niece!
She's not in the house and she's away from your tulips.
Practicing my song for Dutch Day.
Did you get a new dog?
I feel so sad for him, Persephone.
Do you know anything about science?
I don't think this is safe.

Praise be New Holland, Streets so wide and sidewalks clean, Modest homes at modest prices, Everyone's urban dream, Praise be New Holland, Happy children free from tears, Free from all the worlds dangers, Free from crime and free from strangers,  The crowd is so rapt that no one notices the big  THUNDERSTORM brewing overhead.
Praise be New Holland, May your windmill spin forever more.
Get back! Stay away from us!
I can't hold on much longer!
I heard it was a cemetery.
How are we supposed to see an invisible goldfish?
No. That's why it's called an experiment. We have to collect data.
That fish you showed us, was it real?
You say you know Victor's secret.
No, no, no! Stop you put me down-
Victor! Victor I need help please.
First prize is a huge trophy!
Yeah, well, our science fair project is even cooler.
Sea monkeys. We gotta come up with something better. Bigger.
The science fair is in two days!
Are you sure this is going to work?
Do we have to collect it on me?
We could use a test dummy or something.
Whoah, woah, w-w-w-woah woah, whoah, woah, woah, woah.
Toshiaki, still filming looks down to find Bob sprawled on the grass. His arm is bent at an impossible angle.
I can't believe I broke my arm for nothing. None of us are going to win. E has an invisible fish.
Sea Monkeys. You know how on the package, they're like in a happy kingdom and everyone's smiling?
They're not like that at all.
They built New Holland on an abandoned gold mine...
That's where they buried the miners.
Mr. Whiskers had a dream about you last night.
Because this morning, he made this.
Last month he dreamed about Bob.
He dreamed about Toshiaki the day he pitched a perfect game.
...and Nassor the day he got knocked unconscious.
If Mr. Whiskers dreams about you, it means something big is going to happen.
One day you'll dream about me, won't you kitty?
Here Mr Whiskers! Here kitty kitty Mr Whiskers.
It's the windmill that does it.
Turning, turning the air until the sky itself rages against the night.
Toshiaki says you have an invisible fish.
Toshiaki says it's your science fair project.
So it isn't?    Or it is?
Do you have an invisible fish?
It's just water. There's nothing there.
I don't know what kind of game you and Victor are playing. But that trophy will be mine!
No he doesn't. You fell for a parlor trick.
You brought an animal back from the dead?
Victor will win the science fair.
Tonight, we shall bring the dead to life.
Ah. The tomb of Collosus soon you shall be awakened and we shall be reunited once again.
Rise, colossus. Rise from your tomb!

Because you have to have a partner for the science fair and whoever's your partner is going to win. You know the most about science. So pick me as a partner. I have lots of ideas. We could make a death ray!
Victor and Sparky look over to see that ...
All I know is, I'll be teaching the class for the rest of the semester.
I know more than you do.
Well, sometimes knowing too much is the problem.
Oh, it's still on. But it will be judged by someone who is not insane -- Me!
Now get cracking and may the best person win.
Desperate for a place to hide, Burgemeister spots a porta-
I know, and Helen said she thought he was putting up some kind of tv antenna on top of the roof!
Sweetie are you ok? Here you go.
In the middle of a thunderstorm?
And did you get that big power surge in the night? Jack thought it was a fuse box but apparently it effected the whole neighbourhood.
Sometimes I wonder just what goes on in that house. I just don't feel safe walking by there.
So anyway Jack loves it here but if the schools weren't so great sometimes I wonder if we would be better of...
Can I help you young man?
Have you looked through this "science" book they're using?
When I was a kid, Pluto was a great planet. This guy comes along and rewrites the rules.
My Cynthia has been asking all sorts of strange questions. About things I've never even heard of!
Persephone sniffs along the fence as well.
